description: Numbers that are not the sum of 3 hexagonal numbers (probably finite).
comments: _Jud McCranie_ remarks that a(638) = 146858 is probably the last term.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..638
R. K. Guy, Every number is expressible as the sum of how many polygonal numbers?, Amer. Math. Monthly 101 (1994), 169-172.
mathematica: notSumQ[n_] := Reduce[0 <= x <= y <= z && n == x*(2x - 1) + y*(2y - 1) + z*(2z - 1), {x, y, z}, Integers] === False; A007536 = Reap[ Do[ If[notSumQ[n], Print[n]; Sow[n]], {n, 1, 135}]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jun 27 2012 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
